headline.main: The Times' Letters from the South.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: I have read with deep interest the series of letters from the South published in your columns. Circumstances have made me quite familiar with the field of your correspondent's investigation, much more familiar than he is at present, and yet I am happy to say, that his letters are more satisfactory than any I have ever seen relating to the South.
docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: I have read with deep interest the series of letters from the South published in your columns. Circumstances have made me quite familiar with the field of your correspondent's investigation, much more...

docs.lead_paragraph: We improve in trifles but slowly. In great things our attention is at once absorbed and our energies enlisted, while many minor matters quite as conducive to personal comfort as great inventions, seem to be most unaccountably overlooked.
docs.snippet: We improve in trifles but slowly. In great things our attention is at once absorbed and our energies enlisted, while many minor matters quite as conducive to personal comfort as great inventions, seem to be most unaccountably overlooked.

headline.main: FRANCE.; The Budget--The Empress--The Approaching Coronntion--General French News--Foreign Items, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bill fixing the general budget of receipts and expenditures for 1854, was communicated to the Legislative, body on Friday. The summary of the eighth and ninth articles, of this bill, as printed in the London journals from telegraphic dispatches transmitted Friday evening, is erroneous.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: There must always be a certain class of thinkers, who will want to know how things in general, or in particular, are going. Facts are no facts for them unless figures show the certificates.
docs.snippet: There must always be a certain class of thinkers, who will want to know how things in general, or in particular, are going. Facts are no facts for them unless figures show the certificates.

docs.lead_paragraph: LECTURE VI.--MARIOLATRY--ST. PATRICK. The Sixth lecture in the course was delivered by Father GAVAZZI, at the Tabernacle, last evening. Judging from the attendance, the public interest in those lectures does not at all abate as they progress.
docs.snippet: LECTURE VI.--MARIOLATRY--ST. PATRICK. The Sixth lecture in the course was delivered by Father GAVAZZI, at the Tabernacle, last evening. Judging from the attendance, the public interest in those lectures does not at all abate as they progress.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE REPORTED SUICIDE OF A WOMAN WITH OIL OF TANSY-THE CORONER'S INQUEST.-Yesterday, Coroner O'DoNNELL proceeded to the residence of Mrs. MARY, ANN CUDDY, at No. 245 Eighth-avenue, and summoned a Jury to investigate the cause of her death.
docs.snippet: THE REPORTED SUICIDE OF A WOMAN WITH OIL OF TANSY-THE CORONER'S INQUEST.-Yesterday, Coroner O'DoNNELL proceeded to the residence of Mrs. MARY, ANN CUDDY, at No. 245 Eighth-avenue, and summoned a Jury to investigate the cause of her death.

headline.main: HAVANA.; Vice-President King Sworn In-Arrival of the Saranac--More Negroes Landed--Galiano to Resign--Government Movements Santa Anna in Havana, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: On the 24th inst., at 12 o'clock, the ceremony of administration of the oath to Mr. KING as Vice-President of the United States, took place at the estate of Ariadne, by WM. L. SHARKEY, Consul of the United States at the Havana, assisted by Hon. GEORGE W. JONES, M. H. R. from Tennessee, and several American citizens who went down from Havana for the purpose of being present.
docs.snippet: On the 24th inst., at 12 o'clock, the ceremony of administration of the oath to Mr. KING as Vice-President of the United States, took place at the estate of Ariadne, by WM. L. SHARKEY, Consul of the United States at the Havana, assisted by Hon....

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: ROWDYISM ON SUNDAY--A MAN STABBED.--The filth of society floated on the surface on Sunday. The pestilent rowdies, comprising the thieves and black guards of Brooklyn, with a considerable importation of New-York scoundrels, were active in misdeeds.
docs.snippet: ROWDYISM ON SUNDAY--A MAN STABBED.--The filth of society floated on the surface on Sunday. The pestilent rowdies, comprising the thieves and black guards of Brooklyn, with a considerable importation of New-York scoundrels, were active in misdeeds.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have papers from Santa Fe to the 26th of February. The Gazette has the following items: Gov. LANE will leave on the 28th, on a visit of exploration and observation down the country. One or two gentlemen of this city will accompany him.
docs.snippet: We have papers from Santa Fe to the 26th of February. The Gazette has the following items: Gov. LANE will leave on the 28th, on a visit of exploration and observation down the country. One or two gentlemen of this city will accompany him.
